Description: Funerary papyrus of Tasheretennesmin containing original text partly adapted from the Second Book of Breathing written in hieratic script verso and recto. A single line of demotic is written on the verso.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Thebes. Possibly from the tomb of the archon Soter, but apparently unconnected with his family (see Herbin 2008, 127).
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E.A. Wallis Budge, A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms (London 1922), p.298, no.22. B.H. Stricker, OMRO 23 (1942), p.33. Herbin, F.-R., Books of Breathing and Related Texts (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead and Other Related Texts in the British Museum IV), London, 2008, pp. 126-132, pls. 100-103.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (252)
Herbin 2008 / Books of Breathing and Related Texts (pp.126-132, pls.100-103)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57782) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57782)
Vleeming 2015 / Demotic graffiti and other short texts gathered from many publications (no.2004, p.349)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: good
